intro: Gilia lutea var. acicularis, commonly known as the needleleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. Its structure and growth habits make it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
